intro: Plantago coronopus subsp. ceratophylla, commonly known as the horned plantain, is a flowering plant belonging to the Plantaginaceae family. It is characterized by its rosette of broad, wavy leaves and produces small, greenish flowers in dense clusters. This subspecies is typically found in moist, calcareous soils in coastal and inland areas. The plant is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported healing properties. It is also an important food source for various insect species.
